recipeDescriptionLines.recipeDescriptionLine: Kerala Chicken Curry is a chicken stew cooked in tomato and onion based sauce. Various spices are used to enhance the taste.

There are number of variations that can be made to this dish and below is just one of those. Depending  on the style of preparation, the chicken curry can be made sweet, spicy with different texture. The curry is best enjoyed hot with rotis, rice or pooris.

Chicken is a very good source of protein.4 ounces has approx 67% of the daily value of protein. It also contains vitamins and other nutrients. It is one of the safest meat and widely consumed all over the world. However, we should be careful to eat only the healthy part of the meat. Chicken breast is considered as the healthiest part of it.

procedureSteps.stepDescription: Wash chicken thoroughly, marinate it with 1 tbsp salt, lemon juice and 1/4 tbsp turmeric for an hour.
In a kadai (wok) put oil, once heated, add onions and fry until golden brown. Keep the stove on medium heat.

make a paste of ginger, garlic and green chillies. Add to cooked onions an fry for 2 mins. Add remaining 1/4 tbsp of turmeric, coriander, red chilly and garam masala powder. Fry for 1 minute. Frying the masala ensures no raw taste of it.
Add tomatoes and curry leaves. Fry until oil is separated.
Add chicken and water as per the thickness that you want. Cover and cook the chicken on medium heat until it gets cooked completely (takes approx 30 mins). Keep stirring in between to avoid burning.
Once cooked, garnish with coriander leaves. Serve hot with rice, puris, rotis.
